caption: I enjoyed spending a couple hours wandering through the Plants Garden (Jardin des Plantes) during a recent trip to Paris. There are around 28 hectares of space that includes medicinal plant and rose gardens, rural grounds and otherwise green and leisure space. You will also find several museums, exhibition galleries, greenhouse, zoo and numerous monuments spread around the Gardens.  It is a nice place to take pause from the busy streets of the city and enjoy a hour or two in quieter, more peaceful grounds.

Went here towards the end of our trip, mainly to get away from the Centre of Paris to chill out. It's a really cute and relaxing location. Plenty of places to walk to. We paid to get into the botanical garden. Gets really nice when the sun starts to lower especially with the leaves this time of year.
Huge park, wide, sandy running track around it. Amazing trees, spring will be incredible with the Japanese blossoms. We visited on a gorgeous autumn day

A nice getaway park from the city noise. Pleasant to walk around and admire the statues and installations. I would advise to come when the sun starts to set, that way you get the daylight views and the illuminations when they switch the lights on which is on the installtions. I feel like there could be a few more vendors and public toilet facilities within the park but still, a worthwhile visit especially if you have children.
Excellent Christmas light show. We loved it and the accessible entry was very helpful and necessary.
A beautiful and well-maintained park. A good place to cool off on hot summer days. There are also nice museums you can visit in the park. I visited the one about mineralogy.

Spent 5-6 hours wandering around this garden in late August. A great variety of plants, trees, buildings to view and explore. Very excited to find a wollemi pine beside the stegosaurus at the paleontology museum. Down the river seine side. üëç Menagerie kept kids going for 3 hours. Little zoo. The oldest iron monument in Paris.

I wasn't previously aware of this gem of Paris! It's one of the stops in the Batobus boats that carry tourists to a variety of the most popular scenes along the Seine. Those tours were well worth it for us!!! Also, the gardens are free of charge and there is a little public restroom building through the back gate and to the left on the street corner!
A place unique in the world! Fascinating exhibit halls, incredible gardens.   Find the secret alpine garden, if you can!

The Jardin des Plantes in Paris is a historic and beautifully maintained botanical garden, offering free admission to visitors, making it an ideal spot for nature lovers, families, and tourists. Established in 1626, it covers over 28 hectares and features a wide variety of plants, trees, and themed gardens, including a rose garden, winter garden, and medicinal plant beds. Visitors can also explore greenhouses filled with exotic and tropical plants, offering a glimpse into different ecosystems.  Beyond the gardens, the site houses the Mus√©um National d'Histoire Naturelle, with exhibits on geology, paleontology, and zoology. While the garden itself is free, some attractions within, like the M√©nagerie zoo, one of the oldest in the world, require paid admission.  Jardin des Plantes offers a tranquil, educational escape in the heart of Paris. Its free access to beautifully landscaped areas and rich plant life makes it an essential destination for anyone seeking a peaceful break from the city's hustle, while additional paid attractions add depth to the experience.

We visited in August, when many of the plants were in bloom. It was a delightful, tranquil walk in the middle of the city. You could easily spend the whole day there, admiring the endless variety of flowers.
Beautiful and surprisingly quiet even though is in the middle of a busy neighbourhood. So pretty!!

A great little place to spend an hour or two. Beautiful landscape, loads of plants, plenty of walking space. We also visited the arboretum. That was ok but not worth the ticket price. However the gardens are free and not crowded. Definitely a beautiful place to visit.

I honestly can‚Äôt believe this place is free! Well the gardens anyway! But they are vast and incredibly diverse, so even on a wet and grey day you will still experience a wonder and if anything it will just be more quiet. Really easy to get to and as it‚Äôs mostly flat there aren‚Äôt any major accessibility issues: lots of seating and fun places to hide. It really needs to be visited.
Lovely place to spend quality time, if you got enough of crowded, turistic Paris places.
Great place to visit for a walk through the scenery. A lot of nice plants. The greenhouse does cost and is not that big, so it only takes 5-10min to visit it.
A very beautiful garden and it allows access to many museums as well.

An enchanting escape in the heart of the city. The Jardin des Plantes offers a serene atmosphere, impeccably maintained grounds, and a remarkable collection of flora. Strolling through its lush paths is both inspiring and soothing. A haven of beauty and tranquility, perfect for nature enthusiasts and peaceful contemplation.

Free admission for the park. Nice layout and design. There‚Äôs also a rose garden. Had a lovely time walking around the park, very soothing and relaxing! A nice little quiet place within the busy city!
It's a great way to spend an afternoon after arriving via train at Gare de Lyon, or if not, head that way anyways. You won't be disappointed!

Perfect! This is my second spring I visit this park. Every year the flowers change, so you can admire different Spring flowers. And there are a lot of trees and bushes blooming in Spring.  You have several museums to visit and a greenhouse with tropical flowers. You can also visit a small Zoo situated in this park. This year we found a Mary-goes-round for children, the price is 3 euros. You can also purchase food and coffee. There is open space for children to play near the Zoo.  The toilets are free and tidy.

The garden was nice to walk through. It's cold now, so most of the plants are hibernating. But the area has been decorated for their night light show. The area is extremely clean and the decorations are nice to see. Hopefully we get the opportunity to visit at night someday.
Beautiful garden. Wish we had more time to enjoy it. We walked through the garden after visiting the Mosque, which is also worth the visit. Very well maintained garden with blooms.
What beautiful canopies to spend time reading, painting, writing, or just watching the world! Right in the middle of Paris!

Fantastic and colorful art made from local people. This exhibition is bigger than it looks as it took me a little over an hour to see including the picture taking. They have animal art from Asia, Africa, South America, etc. All the art is handmade and beautiful. My favorite was the huge snake figure that is also a mini tunnel. Great area for kids as the zoo is next door to this garden.
My favorite garden in Paris. Lots of flowers and don‚Äôt miss the wallabies

Even if you only have a few days to visit Paris, you should definitely stop at this Jardin! It‚Äôs absolutely gorgeous. It‚Äôs filled with lots of different flowers and plants, the variety of colours is absolutely stunning. The entrance is free for everyone and there is even a little playground for kids. If you have some spear time, there are lots of museums in this park, that all together make up the Natural History Museum. Museums are free if you are under 26 and from EU.

Free to get into the botanical gardens. Very beautiful. The benches weren‚Äôt very clean and sad that you can‚Äôt actually smell the roses in the rose garden as you can‚Äôt walk on the grass. Didn‚Äôt spend very long here as there were lots of people and children.
Expansive and well manicured garden open to the public. Able to leisurely stroll through the quiet environment.

I went to visit recently for the botanical exhibit : Milles & Une Orchid√©es. üå∫  üòû A beautiful time that was unfortunately ruined by the rude staff rude during the wait time : the lines were badly managed, and they had many arguments in front of other visitors because they didn't want to sell tickets. Don't expect to access the exhibit as the same time you chosed on your ticket, I waited +35 minutes in line..  üëé Very unprofessional to me, as I never experienced such behavior in other museums and exhibitions places.  üéüÔ∏è Be sure to book your tickets in advance, they refuse to sell you any if it's a busy exhibition.  ‚òîÔ∏è Be sure to avoid visiting Jardin des Plantes when it is raining! It was terrible to walk throughout the garden as it very long to walk from one point to another, the sand paths gather a lot of dirt and puddles..  üó∫Ô∏è The place is not that clearly mapped on site, which is annoying if it is your first time visiting. They don't have a map at the entry, we had to ask security members to kindly gives us directions.  üõÖ Don't bring large belongings as there is barely enough storage to keep your stuff. The lock I had was half-broken, I was not resting easy during my visit, as I was asked to leave my belongings behind.  ‚ú® The positive note however is the exhibition itself was beautiful crafted. I enjoyed it and it was worth the price !

Amazing. Lovely and big park. The air is so fresh and the walk ways are wide. Very clean and perfect for kids to run and play. The number of attraction and museum is amazing. The only problem is that the museum as well as the "manege" close at 6pm which is very early since the sunset is at 10 pm
Beautiful restoration job the exterior is still in progress.  It's nice to go when there is an organ recital gives you the feeling of the massiveness of this building.

A calm oasis in the middle of the city, perfect for a break from the usual hustle. The gardens were lovely, offering a peaceful environment surrounded by greenery. I enjoyed walking around the pathways and admiring the variety of plants from different parts of the world

An amazing park with great smooth benches under the tree shadows. In some places the gardens are AMAZING in others not so much. Again you can't walk on the grass but you appreciate the beauty of nature. There are also a couple of toilets in the park

üåø Jardin des Plantes is a botanical garden that belongs to the National Museum of Natural History. It was founded in 1635 as a royal medicinal garden and has four centuries of scientific adventures. It covers 28 hectares and has various collections of plants, trees, flowers and herbs.  üëç I liked this place, which is nice to walk around if you like parks. It has different thematic gardens, such as the alpine garden, the rose garden, the iris garden and the ecological garden. It also has several greenhouses that display tropical and desert plants. It is a peaceful and relaxing place in the heart of Paris.  üëé The only drawback is that some parts of the garden are not very well maintained and look a bit neglected. It could use some more care and attention.  üåü I give 4 stars to this place, which is a beautiful and educational place to visit. It also has several museums and a zoo that are worth seeing. It is a great place for nature lovers and families.
Beautiful garden and paths. Will have to visit the buildings next time.

One of the few parks in Paris. And as such one of the few opportunities to visit a green space in the capital during a weekend. A nice place to walk with your children. And then there is also the Natural History Museum in this park which in itself is really worth a long visit.
Very beautiful place with a lot of flowers. Trees were in blossom. Free entrance to the public gardens. Have to pay for the botanical gardens.
